title: China State Council opens Chinese Library in Mexico City
description: In 2017, The China State Council opened a Chinese library in Mexico City at Anahuac University. The library, supported by the State Council Information Office of China, opened to support and facilitate cultural exchange between China and Mexico. The library houses 6,000 books and 80,000 digital archives with information on Chinese culture and history.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China State Council opens Chinese Library in Mexico City

# Description
In 2017, The China State Council opened a Chinese library in Mexico City at Anahuac University. The library, supported by the State Council Information Office of China, opened to support and facilitate cultural exchange between China and Mexico. The library houses 6,000 books and 80,000 digital archives with information on Chinese culture and history.
justification: Project is focused on cultural exchange and education without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Chinese library for cultural exchange, 6,000 books and 80,000 digital archives on Chinese culture and history

title: China hosts Mexican Students for Traditional Chinese Medicine Acupuncture and Massage Training
description: In 2017, China hosted students in Mexico for training on traditional Chinese medicine acupuncture and massage training. On 18 July 2017, the People’s Republic of China’s Embassy in Mexico hosted a Symposium on Traditional Chinese Medicine Acupuncture and Massage Training. The seminar was called the 2017年墨西哥中医针灸推拿技术培训班--the English translation is the 2017 Mexican Acupuncture and Tui Na Technical Training Course. At the symposium Mexican students shared their experience of studying in China.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China hosts Mexican Students for Traditional Chinese Medicine Acupuncture and Massage Training

# Description
In 2017, China hosted students in Mexico for training on traditional Chinese medicine acupuncture and massage training. On 18 July 2017, the People’s Republic of China’s Embassy in Mexico hosted a Symposium on Traditional Chinese Medicine Acupuncture and Massage Training. The seminar was called the 2017年墨西哥中医针灸推拿技术培训班--the English translation is the 2017 Mexican Acupuncture and Tui Na Technical Training Course. At the symposium Mexican students shared their experience of studying in China.
justification: Project focuses on education and cultural exchange in traditional medicine, with no direct environmental or energy transition impact
evidence: Training program for traditional Chinese medicine, cultural exchange initiative, educational focus

title: The Chinese Embassy in Mexico Grants Chinese Government Scholarships to Mexican Students for 2017-2018 Academic Year
description: On 7 August 2017, Qiu Xiaoqi, the Chinese Ambassador to Mexico awarded Chinese government scholarships for the 2017-2018 academic year. During the ceremony Ambassador Qiu congratulates the Mexican students for obtaining the scholarships and encouraged them to take full advantage of their opportunities to study and live in China, personally feel the development and changes of China, understand the colorful culture of China, and lay a solid foundation for becoming a messenger of friendly exchanges and cooperation between China and Mexico.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
The Chinese Embassy in Mexico Grants Chinese Government Scholarships to Mexican Students for 2017-2018 Academic Year

# Description
On 7 August 2017, Qiu Xiaoqi, the Chinese Ambassador to Mexico awarded Chinese government scholarships for the 2017-2018 academic year. During the ceremony Ambassador Qiu congratulates the Mexican students for obtaining the scholarships and encouraged them to take full advantage of their opportunities to study and live in China, personally feel the development and changes of China, understand the colorful culture of China, and lay a solid foundation for becoming a messenger of friendly exchanges and cooperation between China and Mexico.
justification: Project focuses on educational scholarships and cultural exchange without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Chinese government scholarships for Mexican students, focus on cultural exchange and education

title: China Zhejiang Police Academy Holds Special Training Class for the Mexican police
description: In July 2017, the China Zhejiang Police Academy will hold a special training class for the Mexican police in July. On 30 June 2017, the Ambassador to Mexico went to the Chinese Embassy in Mexico to prepare the Mexican police for their travels to China for training.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
China Zhejiang Police Academy Holds Special Training Class for the Mexican police

# Description
In July 2017, the China Zhejiang Police Academy will hold a special training class for the Mexican police in July. On 30 June 2017, the Ambassador to Mexico went to the Chinese Embassy in Mexico to prepare the Mexican police for their travels to China for training.
justification: Project involves police training and capacity building without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Special training class for Mexican police, focus on law enforcement capacity building

title: Chinese Academy of Governance Holds 2017 Overseas Training Class for Mexican Public Sector Personnel
description: On 25 September 2017, Qiu Xiaoqi, Ambassador to Mexico, was invited to attend the opening ceremony of the "2017 Overseas Training Class for Mexican Public Sector Personnel" (2017年墨西哥公共部门人员教育研修师资海外研修班). The training session was held by the Chinese Academy of Governance at the National School of Public Administration of Mexico. More than 100 people attended the event, including the Deputy dean of the China National School of Administration, Dean of the National School of Public Administration of Mexico, and representatives of teachers and students from China and Mexico. The Mexican participants take the opportunity to learn more about China and exchange their experiences in governance and public administration.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
Chinese Academy of Governance Holds 2017 Overseas Training Class for Mexican Public Sector Personnel

# Description
On 25 September 2017, Qiu Xiaoqi, Ambassador to Mexico, was invited to attend the opening ceremony of the "2017 Overseas Training Class for Mexican Public Sector Personnel" (2017年墨西哥公共部门人员教育研修师资海外研修班). The training session was held by the Chinese Academy of Governance at the National School of Public Administration of Mexico. More than 100 people attended the event, including the Deputy dean of the China National School of Administration, Dean of the National School of Public Administration of Mexico, and representatives of teachers and students from China and Mexico. The Mexican participants take the opportunity to learn more about China and exchange their experiences in governance and public administration.
justification: Project focuses on education and knowledge exchange in public administration, with no direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training class for public sector personnel, focus on governance and public administration, educational exchange between China and Mexico

title: [China Co-Financing Fund] IDB administers $37.6 million loan from CHC for Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios
description: On August 24, 2017, the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) signed signed two loan contracts with the Government of Mexico to finance the Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios: a $612.4 million loan that IDB issued from its ordinary capital (Loan 4072/OC-ME), and a $37.6 million loan from the People's Bank of China (Loan 4071/CH-ME) via the China Co-Financing Fund for Latin America and the Caribbean (CHC). The $650 million of loan financing authorized by IDB was designed to cover the total program cost. The IDB approval date for the loan financing was June 6, 2017, and it refers to this project as ‘ME-L1253 : Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios’. The CHC loan carries the following borrowing terms: a 12.5-year maturity, a 12.5-year grace period, a 0.75% commitment (credit) fee, no management fee, and an annual interest rate of 3-month LIBOR plus a 0.1% funding margin (also known as the ‘Bank’s Cost of Funding’) and a 0.85% IDB lending spread. The full amount of the loan was scheduled for repayment on the loan’s final maturity date (February 15, 2030) as a ‘bullet payment.’   The program's overall purpose was to strengthen the fiscal regulation, policy, transparency, responsibility, and long-term sustainability of subnational, including state and municipal, governments in Mexico. This was accomplished through policy reforms and structural changes in the management of public finances for these governments. These included, for example, the establishment of the Financial Discipline Law of Federative Entities and Municipalities (Ley de Disciplina Financiera de las Entidades Federativas y los Municipios) to create updated fiscal management rules, and the creation of registries to publish, for the public to view, information on local governments' debt obligations and finances. It also included training programs for government officials about the reforms. Many of these reforms also had the goal of increasing macroeconomic stability. 11 states and 105 municipalities had sufficient levels of indebtedness, over a certain baseline, to be of interest to the program.  By the end of 2019, 5 states and 33 municipalities had levels of indebtedness above this baseline, exceeding the goal for states but missing the goal for municipalities.  The final disbursement, for the total of both the IDB and China Co-Financing Fund loans, was made on August 24, 2018. Project execution ended during the first half of 2019.   The Secretariat of Finance and Public Credit (Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público - SHCP) was responsible for project execution, including its International Finance Affairs Unit (Unidad de Asuntos Internacionales de Hacienda, UAIH), which helped design the program, and its Federal Entities Coordination Unit (Unidad de Coordinación con Entidades Federativas, UCEF). The UCEF helped carry out technical work prior to, and helped facilitate evaluation and program monitoring during, project execution.
staff_comments: 1. The CHC loan agreement can be accessed in its entirety via https://www.dropbox.com/s/21gtnonj8kbg84b/CONTRATO%20DE%20PR%C3%89STAMO%20No.%204071%3ACH-ME.pdf?dl=0. 2. The second part of the Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios was wholly funded by the IDB's ordinary capital with a $600 million loan. 3. AidData has estimated the all-in interest rate (2.25%) by adding average 3-month LIBOR in the third quarter of 2017 (1.3%) to the funding margin during the third quarter of 2017 (0.10%) and the IDB lending spread during the third quarter of 2017 (0.85%). 4. According to the CHC loan contract, the ‘Bank's Cost of Funding’ means a cost margin calculated quarterly relative to a three (3)-month LIBOR Dollar Interest Rate, using the weighted average cost of funding instruments applicable to the Flexible Financing Facility, expressed in terms of an annual percentage, as determined by the Bank. AidData identified this cost margin via https://idbdocs.iadb.org/wsdocs/getdocument.aspx?docnum=EZSHARE-1436601171-376. 5. The China Co-Financing Fund for Latin America and the Caribbean was established on January 14, 2013 with a contribution of $2 billion by the People's Bank of China. It is administered by the IDB. For more information, see umbrella Project ID#86526.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
[China Co-Financing Fund] IDB administers $37.6 million loan from CHC for Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios

# Description
On August 24, 2017, the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) signed signed two loan contracts with the Government of Mexico to finance the Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios: a $612.4 million loan that IDB issued from its ordinary capital (Loan 4072/OC-ME), and a $37.6 million loan from the People's Bank of China (Loan 4071/CH-ME) via the China Co-Financing Fund for Latin America and the Caribbean (CHC). The $650 million of loan financing authorized by IDB was designed to cover the total program cost. The IDB approval date for the loan financing was June 6, 2017, and it refers to this project as ‘ME-L1253 : Program to Strengthen Fiscal Management in Federative Entities and Municipios’. The CHC loan carries the following borrowing terms: a 12.5-year maturity, a 12.5-year grace period, a 0.75% commitment (credit) fee, no management fee, and an annual interest rate of 3-month LIBOR plus a 0.1% funding margin (also known as the ‘Bank’s Cost of Funding’) and a 0.85% IDB lending spread. The full amount of the loan was scheduled for repayment on the loan’s final maturity date (February 15, 2030) as a ‘bullet payment.’   The program's overall purpose was to strengthen the fiscal regulation, policy, transparency, responsibility, and long-term sustainability of subnational, including state and municipal, governments in Mexico. This was accomplished through policy reforms and structural changes in the management of public finances for these governments. These included, for example, the establishment of the Financial Discipline Law of Federative Entities and Municipalities (Ley de Disciplina Financiera de las Entidades Federativas y los Municipios) to create updated fiscal management rules, and the creation of registries to publish, for the public to view, information on local governments' debt obligations and finances. It also included training programs for government officials about the reforms. Many of these reforms also had the goal of increasing macroeconomic stability. 11 states and 105 municipalities had sufficient levels of indebtedness, over a certain baseline, to be of interest to the program.  By the end of 2019, 5 states and 33 municipalities had levels of indebtedness above this baseline, exceeding the goal for states but missing the goal for municipalities.  The final disbursement, for the total of both the IDB and China Co-Financing Fund loans, was made on August 24, 2018. Project execution ended during the first half of 2019.   The Secretariat of Finance and Public Credit (Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público - SHCP) was responsible for project execution, including its International Finance Affairs Unit (Unidad de Asuntos Internacionales de Hacienda, UAIH), which helped design the program, and its Federal Entities Coordination Unit (Unidad de Coordinación con Entidades Federativas, UCEF). The UCEF helped carry out technical work prior to, and helped facilitate evaluation and program monitoring during, project execution.
justification: Project focuses on fiscal management and policy reforms without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Strengthening fiscal regulation, policy transparency, and public finance management; no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: Chinese Consulate General in Tijuana, Yu Bo donates laptops to Tijuana’s Police Department in 2017
description: In 2017, the Consulate of the People’s Republic of China in Tijuana, Yu Bo donated office laptops to the Tijuana Police Department or the Secretariat of Security and Civilian Protection of Tijuana. The specific amount of laptops donated or their worth is unknown.
staff_comments: 1. The receiving agency is also known as the Secretariat of Municipal Security of Tijuana (Secretaría de Seguridad Pública Municipal) (now known as Secretariat of Security and Civilian Protection of Tijuana, or Secretaría de Seguridad y Protección Ciudadana Municipal).

title: China Eximbank provides a $80 million USD loan to Total Play Telecomuincaciones, S.A. DE C.V. for expansion of its telecommunications network
description: In 2017, the Export-Import Bank of China provided a $80,000,000 USD loan to Mexican telecommunications network Total Play Telecomunicaciones, S.A. DE C.V. The loan will finance the expansion of Total Play's network expansion.

title: Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs provides a $45,000 USD grant to the Micronesian Department of Foreign Affairs
description: On December 21, 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Micronesia signed a letter of agreement in which the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China provided a $45,000 USD grant to the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Federated States of Micronesia for unspecified purposes. A resolution was submitted to the Congress of the Federated States of Micronesia on January 29, 2018, and it was approved on May 24, 2018.
staff_comments: Project_status was set as Completion because all Chinese financing was disbursed.
combined_text:
# Sector
GOVERNMENT AND CIVIL SOCIETY

# Title
Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs provides a $45,000 USD grant to the Micronesian Department of Foreign Affairs

# Description
On December 21, 2017, the Chinese Government and the Government of Micronesia signed a letter of agreement in which the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China provided a $45,000 USD grant to the Department of Foreign Affairs of the Federated States of Micronesia for unspecified purposes. A resolution was submitted to the Congress of the Federated States of Micronesia on January 29, 2018, and it was approved on May 24, 2018.
justification: Financial grant with no specified environmental or energy-related purpose
evidence: Unspecified grant between foreign affairs departments, no energy or environmental components mentioned

title: China implements 2018 training course on coconut pest control technologies in Micronesia
description: On 27 March 2017, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Micronesian President Christian discussed bilateral cooperation and presumably signed an unspecified agreement in which China pledged to carry out a training course on coconut pest control technologies (or 椰子病虫害防治技术培训班) in Micronesia. The Chinese Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs organized and likely sponsored the group of Chinese experts to travel to Micronesia.   The Chinese Academy of Tropical Agricultural Services (CATAS) sent a 12-member team to carry out the nation-wide workshop which took place between 11 June and 5 July, 2018. It was implemented in all four of Micronesia's states: Yap, Chuuk, Pohnpei, and Kosrae. The team conducted a total of 90 courses with over 100 trainees.   The training courses focused on knowledge and techniques related to high-yield cultivation, pest and disease control, identifying coconut varieties, and hybrid seed production.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
China implements 2018 training course on coconut pest control technologies in Micronesia

# Description
On 27 March 2017, Chinese President Xi Jinping and Micronesian President Christian discussed bilateral cooperation and presumably signed an unspecified agreement in which China pledged to carry out a training course on coconut pest control technologies (or 椰子病虫害防治技术培训班) in Micronesia. The Chinese Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs organized and likely sponsored the group of Chinese experts to travel to Micronesia.   The Chinese Academy of Tropical Agricultural Services (CATAS) sent a 12-member team to carry out the nation-wide workshop which took place between 11 June and 5 July, 2018. It was implemented in all four of Micronesia's states: Yap, Chuuk, Pohnpei, and Kosrae. The team conducted a total of 90 courses with over 100 trainees.   The training courses focused on knowledge and techniques related to high-yield cultivation, pest and disease control, identifying coconut varieties, and hybrid seed production.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural training and knowledge transfer without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Training course on coconut pest control technologies, agricultural knowledge transfer, no direct energy or environmental components
